page.title: 07Upottery's Amenities 1
page.content: When we surveyed our 12 square km. grid area we found that most of the land is used for agriculture and we have few of the amenities which other areas might have. Most of the amenities are in Upottery and Rawridge such as the pub in Upottery where you can drink or eat. There was once a coaching inn called {The Devonshire Inn}on the{A303 road but it is now a farm and has been since before 1900. There is a building called{The Manor {Room}which is used for dances ,whist drives and all sorts of things. Sometimes we perform our school plays there. At the side of it is a tennis court and an area of land where the village fete is held.It is also used as a cricket ground. {
